intro: Brassica petsai, commonly known as watercress, is a leafy green vegetable belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its peppery, slightly spicy flavor and its finely divided, serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as stream banks and wetlands. Its small, white flowers are arranged in racemes and are followed by pods that contain rounded, edible seeds. Brassica petsai is rich in nutrients, including vitamins A, C, and K, as well as minerals like calcium and iron.
